channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: Facebook and TikTok ban Russian state media in Europe. https://t.co/tQOqSvgyoR
How Zelensky Gave the World a Jewish Hero. https://t.co/wlB7XpoEjr
A Few Members of Russia's Parliament Speak Out Against War. https://t.co/iyRL77Xv8W
Two Russian oligarchs call for an end to Putin's war. https://t.co/tLhwMorAEM

Wild and refreshing Catskills creek on a cold sunny day while the world is on fire. 🇺🇦 https://t.co/i12IX7tNjH
BTW that video was taken with my new iPhone 13 Pro that took so long to arrive. There’s a lot of detail in that video. 😀
Also that’s part of the NYC water supply.
One Putin move and behold: West's unity tightens overnight. https://t.co/calw1JNWUR
@chrislhayes don't forget the nukes.
@jasongreen twitter is not a comprehensive communication medium. if you want more i just wrote about it on my blog. the word ukraine does appear there.
@chrishuntwalker It's a very complicated situation.

Everything horrific that Putin has done to the US and Europe, we've done to Russia. We decided that Russia wasn't a superpower, but Russia never went along with that. That violates the basic understanding of the nuclear age, which we are still in.
After the chaos Putin brought to the American political system, it seems reasonable that the new American administration would see if there was a deal they could do to get him to stand down. But I don't think there have been any such discussions.
How the U.S. Should Handle Putin’s Nuclear Threats. https://t.co/VRIe2Ymith

1/3 I have been watching Fox. Their coverage of Ukraine is equal to or better than CNN or MSNBC. They are loving Ukraine. Makes me wonder if Fox was really a Putin property, or if they just gravitated toward stories that raised the ire of their audience.
2/3 The Ukraine story of 2022 is like Gone With The Wind, but the sequel of the sequel, and without slaves. The story has Fox all over it. Remember they liked Mayor Pete there. That was puzzling too.
3/3 For a moment, Putin has brought us together in North America, maybe. We found something we agree on -- it's time for Putin to go. But remember on January 7, 2021 we had that unity too, but it didn't last long
Romney is right: MAGA Republicans are ‘almost treasonous.’ https://t.co/XO9S9gyjLL
Ukraine's army has published a guide where best to target Russian armored vehicles with Molotov cocktails. https://t.co/dKLcQvwLdy

How much better for Putin if he had waited until 2024. Didn't he see that the US is sliding down the path to electing a Putin lapdog in 2024. Why bother with Ukraine? He's about to land the big fish. At 69 he could be sick, and has to play his cards now, or die a failure.

I am a regular user of the free crossword puzzles from The Washington Post, but the Save command only works intermittently, fails more often than not, it just forgets what I’ve done so I have to start over. https://t.co/Esn5WqqlvI
Ukrainian Citizens Prepare to Fight Russian Army. https://t.co/y6Zyl9fpN4
Ukraine's Soldier Granny: Elderly woman says she will defend country from Russian invaders. https://t.co/EFCG9nSSwn
sometimes Worldle is too easy. #Worldle #38 1/6 (100%) 🟩🟩🟩🟩🟩🎉 https://t.co/bnHTZz2fpg
American And British Military Veterans To Fight Russia With Ukraine. https://t.co/J9FReIMqwk
Kyiv's mayor: 'We are encircled' but full of fight. https://t.co/3C1hdyp8cL
U.S. embassy urges Americans in Russia to consider leaving “immediately.” https://t.co/iEw8mXJoBZ
Message to Russian troops from Kyiv's Defenders. https://t.co/n5794kwtJM
Russian IPCC delegate apologizes on Ukraine, saying many ’fail to find any justification for the attack.”. https://t.co/bqEqOSfNXH
Sanctioned Russian TV Host Vladimir Soloviev Cries About Losing His Italian Villa. https://t.co/sNXGt7dw4K
